channel.title: Chessy018 hacked
channel.description:
Specifically, recovered. Which happens to be my favorite form of 'hacking', being that it requires help from the Jagex crew themselves :)
The guy that recovered it worked off information he got from an account his friend recovered(N0valyfe, yeah, the n0valyfe), who had Chessy018 added and social engineered some people on his friends list into divulging her facebook/myspace and other personal details.
Every account Chessy018 traded with over the past few days is locked, including ones that didn't receive any items(which I find extremely funny). Sly(the recoverer) got his account unlocked within the past hour with over 120b on it, the rest is on smaller mules
The total bank value is worth around 170b with street prices and whatnot
[img]http://www.upload.ee/image/1201182/trade.jpg[/img]
[img]http://www.upload.ee/image/1201188/max_trade.jpg[/img]
[img]http://www.upload.ee/image/1201198/tab_1.jpg[/img]
[img]http://www.upload.ee/image/1201158/chessy018.jpg[/img]
Yerp. Pretty crazy imo, say hello to lower santa hat prices once again.

chessy probably did it as media stunt & earn more cash from santas

Read full topic

item.title: Chessy018 hacked
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Yeah, it is a game. But it’s sweet irony that Chessy herself has now also been deprived of the items that she was depriving others of.

Read full topic

item.title: Chessy018 hacked
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:55, topic:386802”]I can tell you from experience acquired in the day to day administration of this website that IP bans are, nine times out of ten, completely ineffective at stopping a user from accessing the site.
Jagex moderators have also mentioned in passing that they don’t ban IP addresses.
Maybe they did back in the day (they were pretty much amateurs, after all), maybe they didn’t. Apparently they don’t anymore.
And how could they? They’ve had millions of players, so it’s highly likely that addresses have been shared between accounts that are otherwise completely unrelated.

Also, I’m glad to see a little socialism at work. Companies in the real world buy out products, or patents for products, and then put the products on ice – effectively depriving humanity of advancement in some cases.
In a way, I like to think of this as punishment for her injudicious behaviour. I don’t mind that she was wealthy, good on her. But depriving people of rare items when she didn’t need to ‘just because’ isn’t really in the spirit of the game in my eyes.

Finally, Jagex doesn’t have as much integrity as people think. When the Tainted Ones discovered the glory dupe years ago, they negotiated with jagex so that one of the people involved would remain unbanned.

It’s entirely plausible that Chessy’s account has indeed been restored to the way it was, on the condition that she keeps her mouth shut about it.
Just because they say something is so doesn’t actually make it so.
There is actually quite a class divide at the end of the day, with some people (player mods, elite players) having a far greater say in things than regular players. It’s like Animal Farm, with some players being ‘more equal’ than others. :P[/quote]This is a game, not reality. In an MMO, it is of critical importance to wipe out any sign of socialism, it’s supposed to be a harsh market. That’s whole damn reason i enjoy it.

Read full topic

item.title: Chessy018 hacked
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I can tell you from experience acquired in the day to day administration of this website that IP bans are, nine times out of ten, completely ineffective at stopping a user from accessing the site.
Jagex moderators have also mentioned in passing that they don’t ban IP addresses.
Maybe they did back in the day (they were pretty much amateurs, after all), maybe they didn’t. Apparently they don’t anymore.
And how could they? They’ve had millions of players, so it’s highly likely that addresses have been shared between accounts that are otherwise completely unrelated.

Also, I’m glad to see a little socialism at work. Companies in the real world buy out products, or patents for products, and then put the products on ice – effectively depriving humanity of advancement in some cases.
In a way, I like to think of this as punishment for her injudicious behaviour. I don’t mind that she was wealthy, good on her. But depriving people of rare items when she didn’t need to ‘just because’ isn’t really in the spirit of the game in my eyes.

Finally, Jagex doesn’t have as much integrity as people think. When the Tainted Ones discovered the glory dupe years ago, they negotiated with jagex so that one of the people involved would remain unbanned.

It’s entirely plausible that Chessy’s account has indeed been restored to the way it was, on the condition that she keeps her mouth shut about it.
Just because they say something is so doesn’t actually make it so.
There is actually quite a class divide at the end of the day, with some people (player mods, elite players) having a far greater say in things than regular players. It’s like Animal Farm, with some players being ‘more equal’ than others.

Read full topic

IP Ban? rofl. They will never do this.
[/quote]

They IP banned a large group of phishers in 2009-2010 on a forum I was on at the time[/quote]

Read full topic

item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

[quote=“cumescape, post:46, topic:386802”][quote author=BloodRayne link=topic=482572.msg3534996#msg3534996 date=1300502152]
And the fact that this guy and his friend recovered Win All Day
[/quote]Why hasn’t he posted a video in YT talking about getting recovered?[/quote]

He has, somewhere he said that his old account “wasn’t secure” or something. He had a bank pin and didn’t lose anything that wasn’t banked, but he still got recovered.

Ollie:

IP Ban? rofl. They will never do this.

They IP banned a large group of phishers in 2009-2010 on a forum I was on at the time

Read full topic

item.title: Chessy018 hacked
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I smell bullshit!

[quote=“Speljohan, post:32, topic:386802”][quote]
Unauthorised access to online accounts whether it is your bank account or your RuneScape account is a criminal offence, it is illegal in the UK under the Computer Misuse Act 1990, and the USA’s Computer Fraud and Abuse Act 1986 as well as equivalent legislation in many other countries around the world. Jagex have already successfully pursued a RuneScape hijacker in the UK using the above law. You can read about it on the BBC news website.

We want to send a clear message that hijacking is not clever and will not do you any favours, it is an illegal act and we regularly send information onto local law enforcement agencies.
[/quote][/quote]

Anyway, good to see Jagex sticking by their guns.

Read full topic

item.title: Chessy018 hacked
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:40, topic:386802”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=482572.msg3535605#msg3535605 date=1300549554]

Surely giving chessy BACK the rares would be taking them out of the economy, because all she was doing was holding them, and lots of them at that. The people who got hold of the account aren’t going to just get rid of them, they’re going to sell them which puts them back into the economy.
[/quote]… as you can see they were WIPED out of the game.

See where? I see nothing.[/quote]

The accounts holding them had their IP’s banned i believe, and chessy’s account is locked.

Read full topic

item.title: Chessy018 hacked
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:42, topic:386802”]They weren’t wiped out, Andy sold them on the ge. They can’t possibly delete them from everyone that bought them in the ge…[/quote]

As soon as we became aware of the situation we acted quickly banning the hijacker’s accounts as well as removing any items & wealth stolen.

I am fairly certain they are able to track individual items through the GE, and as such reimburse the people who purchased and/or replace them silently with legit ones from the GE.

Read full topic
